message:
South: Sullengard
East: Vilegard
West: Nor City
Please respect the park as you enjoy the scenery.

[As you approach the ravine, you notice how quickly the wind has picked-up and it causes you to ponder:] 

Should I proceed or turn around?

replies.text: Absolutely! What's the worse that can happen? I fall?
No way, I'm afraid of heights.

message:
[As you reach this outer most point of the ledge, a big gust of winds blows you off balance and almost down to your death.]

Should I proceed or turn around?

replies.text: Absolutely! What's the worse that can happen? I fall?
No way, that last gust of wind was enough for me! I'm heading back.

message:
[Now that you can't proceed any further, you stop and admire the scenery and this is when you think:]

Do I lean over and take a look at the ravine's bottom?

replies.text: Absolutely! What's the worse that can happen? I fall?
I've already admired this view. It's time to go back.

message:
[You lean over the ledge and that's when you notice the skeletal remains directly below. You can only help but wonder:]

Did this person plunge to their death, or is there a sfae way to get to the bottom?

replies.text: I should head back now before I suffer a similar feat.

message: Apple farming is tough and Deebo overworks us, but please don't tell him i said so.
Welcome to Sullengard, the home to the best beer in Dhayaver. Please enjoy our upcoming 20 anniversarybeer festival.
Welcome to the Sullengard townhall. Please come on in.
Hello there, kid. Happy 20th beer celebration.

replies.text: Do you know where Defy is?

message: Defy already went outside of Sullengard.
I don't know, kid. Others are also looking for them. I'm still busy taking care of my firstborn child.
We should find him or else what shall we do?
More importantly, how could I raise my first bornchild without the share to buy expensive foods and pay high rents here?

replies.text: Calm down. I will find a way to help you.

message: Thank you. You are my only hope here. I don't trust those unlawful Feygard soldiers. You should talk to the head of Thieves Guild about this.
Happy 20th beer celebration, kid.

replies.text: Do you know where Defy is?

message: Go talk to my husband, I'm exhausted and depressed.
Coocoo.
[Giggles cutely]
Welcome to Sullengard, kid. Happy 20th beer celebration!

replies.text: Do you know where Defy is?
We want to contribute gold coins for your financial loss.

message: No. We still don't know where that traitor is. How can we ever sleep peacefully and live sufficiently with this tragic situation?
But please talk to my fellow bootleg brewers. Maybe they know something.
Finally, atleast we can survive for a day with a bread and beer.

replies.text: I noticed that I'm running out of money. I'll be back.

message: Out of my words.
Oh my, thank you kid.
We appreciate it. Thank you, kid.
Small success first before big success.
Thank you so much again, kid. You are just like your brother Andor.

replies.text: Of course, he is my brother.

message: You have a familiar face but taller than you. He is one of the most active member in your guild.
He was considered as the helping hand of Sullengard during the days when we were having rough days just like this scenario.
You must rent the bed! Go talk to the innkeeper.
Hello. I'm Godfrey, and I own this place, but I'm forced to work today because somebody quit on me.
What can I help you with?

replies.text: I need somewhere to relax and refresh. Do you have a bed available?
I'm hungry. Do you have any food to sell?

message: Yes, I do, but it's going to cost you more than you may be expecting.

replies.text: How much will it cost me?

message: Well, it will cost you 700 gold! Beds are always in high demand before and during the Beer Festival.

replies.text: That's too expensive. Let's talk about something else.
I'll take it, but I have to say that you really should join the thieves guild with that attitude!

message: Thank you! It pays to be the owner. You can use any available bed.
Certainly. Please take a look at what I can offer.
Hey, young fellow. I am Kealwea. How can I help you may child?

replies.text: I am in need of supplies. Can you help?
Nanette told me to see you about her pond.

message: Of course my child. Here, let's take a look at what I have.
[Sigh]. Yes, she told me about her pond as well but she won't listen to my story.

replies.text: I will listen to your story.
That will be a long story.

message: I used to go there when I was a young disciple.
One time, as I sitting on the bench thinking on how Feygard soldiers sleep with their unlawful taxes while Sullengard lives on a financial trouble.
My anger arises through the point I lifted up a large rock and thrown it in the pond.
After that, I saw some snappers emerged from the pond and one of them bit my leg. Good thing they are too slow to catch me as I run home.
End of my story with a moral lesson never again to throw rocks there, be it small or large. Thank you for listening. Don't thank me now. Tell her about this.

replies.text: Oh no. I understand now. I have to tell her about this one too. Bye
Oh, good thing it's not a long story. I'm about to snore here. Bye.

message: I've been looking for someone who fits your description.
Yes! You are the one that has killed my fellow "road travellers" and now you must pay!
Yes! You are the one that has killed my fellow "road travellers" and now you must pay!
Yes, you do look like him. He is the one who helped Sullengard financially for their living for how many occasions.

replies.text: Hey, it must be my brother Andor! Tell me more about him.

message: Pay me 750 gold coins first or I'll rob you and then the Sullengard for my living!

replies.text: Fine. Here's 750 gold coins. Now, tell me about him.

message: He is taller and stronger than you. Have a good time!
Hello. Isn't Sullengard a beautiful town?
Hey there.
That's a keen eye you have. Yes, I am worried.

replies.text: I need to move on, sorry.

message: At this point, just the fact that I am lost a little bit. You see, I am travelling to Nor City from the west and I got lost.

replies.text: Well, rest up tonight and head east from here. Following the road and you'll find the Duleian road and go east from there.

message: Thank you so much.
Hey, pal, I can you you just fine. There's no reason to shout. What can I do for you?
Welcome to the Bruyere family home, five-time winners of the 'Best beer in festival' competition.
Welcome to the Briwerra family home, three-time winners of the 'Best beer in festival' competition.
Welcome to the Brueria family home, four-time winners of the 'Best beer in festival' competition.
Welcome to the Brewere family home, five-time winners of the 'Best beer in festival' competition.
Welcome to the Biermann family home, two-time winners of the 'Best beer in festival' competition.
Welcome to the Bierington family home.
Hey there kid. Us three here are brothrs from Stoutfod, but we travel all the way here for the vast greatness of brews! [burp]

replies.text: I'm looking for my my brother Andor. He looks a lot like me, but he is older. Have you seen him?

message: Oh, you know nothing. I feel sorry for you.
Nope. Sorry kid.
[While raising your arm and waving your hand, you yell out:] Yo bar keep! Over here.

replies.text: I would like to see what you have for sale.
I have seen your choices of brews before and I am not interested in those. Can I drink my Brimhaven brew in here?

message: Certainly. I have a menu of the best beers found in not just Sullengard, but in all of Dhayaver.

replies.text: This should be interesting. Let's take a look.

message: No, you can not.
I think you should leave.
Get out of here now. Do not come back until you learn some respect.
What a lovely day for some good quality hard work outside.

replies.text: It sounds like you love being outside.
I will let you get back to your business. Have a great time enjoying the nice weather.
Can I see what you have to trade?

message: I do indeed. But I'll tell you what I really don't enjoy, fixing the property damage done to my farm and losing livestock because of some wild predator!

replies.text: A "predator"? What kind of a predator?
I have killed the Golden jackal and I have the requested proof.
I have killed the Golden jackal, but I can not prove it.

message: Have you seen that Golden jackal around here?

replies.text: No, sir, I have not. Well, at least I don't think I have.
I want to hunt down and kill that Golden jackal for you.

message: Well, it is a four-legged nightmare of a kanine that has destroyed my property and killed my pig. I fear that one of my horses is next.

replies.text: That's terrible news. What are you going to do about it, beside complaining that is?

message: Funny kid you are. I am looking for someone to hunt it down and kill it.

replies.text: Really! I am more than willing and able to do this job for you.

message: That's great to hear! When can you start?

replies.text: Not right now. Can I pick some apples first?

message: You need to leave until you learn some respect.
[You see the mouth open widely.]
[Snap].

replies.text: Ouch. Why you bit me? Bad turtle!
Ouch. Why are you mad at me? Angry turtle!

message: [Sigh]. Oh hello there, kid.
[Sigh]. I'm longing for my pond which I used to enjoy to go to. But now it is dangerous to go in my pond.

replies.text: Well I used to enjoy playing hide-and-seek with my brother but not anymore. Bye.

message: [Sigh]. It started yesterday as I sit on the bench enjoying my pond, I saw vicious sea creatures emerged from the pond.
One of them bit my leg. So I ran away home.
[Sigh]. Please help me for I'm longing to enjoy my pond again.
Remember. It is just south-east from here.
[Sigh] I will tell you once you help me enjoy my pond again.

replies.text: If that's so, then I will not help you.

message: [Sigh]. Oh hello there, kid. Is my pond safe again?

replies.text: Yes, your pond is safe again. May I know the cause of it?

message: I...I still don't know what's the cause of it. You should talk to Kealwea the priest about it.

replies.text: I'm going to visit him now.
What the? But it just happen yesterday.

message: Oh hello there, kid. Have you talk to Kaelwea the priest?

replies.text: There must be a reason why it happen. But what is it?
Yes. He told me to tell you a story.

message: [Sigh]. I'm old enough for a story. Just tell me the moral story of it.

replies.text: Don't throw pebbles on the pond. You might disturb whatever lies beneath it.

message: Oh. I remember now. I kept throwing pebbles on the pond to relief my anger issue caused by the unfair taxes of Feygard.
Thank you so much again, kid. I can now enjoy my pond again. I'll never throw pebbles on the pond again, promise.

replies.text: Promise? Because I'll not clean your mess again.

message: Promise.
Absolutly not.
First, I have to warn you, this is no ordinary forest animal. This thing is capable of dragging away full-szed adult pigs. Be warned now.

replies.text: I am ready! No more talking.
I am not so sure I am capable, but I will give it a try.
I need time to think about the risks.

message: OK, I have faith in you.
The Golden jackal was last seen heading back into the "Sullengard forest" just to the west of my orchard. Return to me with proof of it's death.

Wonderful. Let me have it. [You hand over the Golden jackal's fur]
Ah yes, this is indeed proof it is dead.
Return to me once you have the prrof that it is dead.
As for your reward is concerned, I am now willing to sell and trade with you. Please take a look.
Pick the poisonous mushroom?

replies.text: Sure, why not? What could go wrong?

message: Are you a farmer?

replies.text: No. But I'm a son of an ordinary farmer in a small settlement called Crossglen.
Yes. I'm a son of an ordinary farmer in a small settlement called Crossglen.

message: If you are a son of an ordinary farmer. Then, pick up my pitchfork outside of my house south-west of here.
If you were able to pull it out from the haystack, then it will be yours.
Don't worry about me. I still have one. I bought them from buy-one take-one shop in Nor City. It's a limited shop though.

replies.text: I'll prove it to you that I'm a son of a farmer!
You'll see that you are wrong about me. I'm a son of a farmer!

message: Andor! Good timing you arrive because I need your help to get my husband home on time today.

replies.text: So, my brother Andor was here as well? I'm $playername.
You must be mistaken. I'm $playername and Andor is my brother.

message: I'm sorry, my name is Hadena. He used to visit here but not anymore and I don't know why. But please help me.

replies.text: I'm sorry I can't help you right now. I'm busy.

message: As I said recently, I need your help to get my husband home on time today.
My husband name is Ainsley.
He is working in Deebo's Orchard located east-north of here. Please go there and help him.

replies.text: I'm going now to help him home on time today.
But why your husband will not get home on time?

message: My husband will only get home on time if you give him a new pitchfork from Loneford to get his work done. He is least experienced farmer, so he gets all the crap work to do.

replies.text: Oh. I understand now why. I better go in Loneford now.
That's sad. I'm going now to Loneford.

message: I'm waiting for my husband arrival. Please I want him home on time today.

replies.text: What do yo want me to do again with your husband?
What is the name of your husband?
Where is your husband working again?
Why your husband will not get home on time again?

message: Thank you so much for helping us. You are just like your brother.

replies.text: Of course. He is my brother.
I'm not like him going out from home to anywhere like a cat without talking to my father Mikhail.

message: Both of you are helping Sullengard for our living.
Yikes! You surprise me, kid. I'm Ainsley and I have a lot of work to do here so talk to me later.

replies.text: Just a quick question. Have you seen my brother Andor?

message: Uhhh...yes. No. Maybe. Argh. Sorry kid, I'm so busy right now. I can't even work properly with this old pitchfork.

replies.text: I have a new pitchfork here.
Oops...I don't have a new pitchfork. Be right back.

message: Hadena? Ahh yes. She's my wife. Why do you ask?

replies.text: She told me to give you a new pitchfork so you can come home on time today.
Just asking. I thought you are busy?

message: Yes. I'm inexperienced farmer so I always make a lot of mistakes here and there and everywhere. But experience is the best teacher as they say.

replies.text: Correct. Oops...I don't have the new pitchfork. Be right back.

message: Thank you so much, kid. Tell my wife Ainsley I can come home on time today.

replies.text: I hope you learn from your mistakes.

message:
Welcome to Sullengard.
West: Mt. Galmore
